content:
IConnectionPointContainer Interface

Definition

Provides an implementation of the OLE DB IConnectionPointContainer interface for use by applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

In this Article

[System.Obsolete("Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.* classes are obsolete and supported within 32 bit processes only. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=160862")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.Guid("B196B284-BAB4-101A-B69C-00AA00341D07")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.InterfaceType(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComInterfaceType.InterfaceIsIUnknown)]
public interface IConnectionPointContainer
Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute GuidAttribute InterfaceTypeAttribute

Remarks

For new development, see IConnectionPointContainer.

Note

Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Methods

EnumConnectionPoints(IEnumConnectionPoints)

Creates an enumerator of all the connection points supported in the connectable object, one connection point per IID.

public void EnumConnectionPoints (out Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.IEnumConnectionPoints enumC);
Parameters
enumC
IEnumConnectionPoints

When the method returns, this parameter contains the interface pointer of the enumerator. This parameter is passed uninitialized.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute GuidAttribute InterfaceTypeAttribute

Remarks

For new development, see IConnectionPointContainer.

Note

Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

FindConnectionPoint(Guid, IConnectionPoint)

Queries the connectable object about whether it has a connection point for a particular IID, and, if so, returns the IConnectionPoint interface pointer to that connection point.

public void FindConnectionPoint (ref Guid riid, out Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.IConnectionPoint cp);
Parameters
riid
Guid

A reference to the outgoing interface IID whose connection point is being requested.

cp
IConnectionPoint

When the method returns, this parameter contains the connection point that manages the outgoing interface riid. This parameter is passed uninitialized.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute GuidAttribute InterfaceTypeAttribute

Remarks

For new development, see IConnectionPointContainer.

Note

Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.
